description: Robotics and control systems involve the design and implementation of algorithms that enable robots to perform tasks autonomously. This includes navigation, path planning, and real-time adjustments based on environmental feedback.
you_have_this_if: You are developing a robotic system that requires real-time navigation.
You need to implement visual feedback for path adjustment.
You are working on assistive technologies that require precise control.
You are facing challenges in integrating sensory data for navigation.
You need to optimize the performance of a robotic system in dynamic environments.

approaches.best_for: When building navigation systems for autonomous wheelchairs or assistive technologies.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Offers a balance between computational efficiency and accuracy in real-time applications.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a reliable method for real-time path adjustment in robotics with visual feedback.

start_here: Start with Lightweight Gaussian Process Visual Servoing as it provides a robust framework for real-time navigation and control in robotics, especially in assistive technologies.
